Very safe. A policeman is biking around campus 24/7 to ensure safety.
There's no Greek life, but there are honor societies with Greek names for exceptional students.
There's a club and activity for anyone and everyone.
All students: especially those looking for a small, private, liberal arts setting wishing to grow in faith with Christ.
The ADC (caf) used to be underground, but not anymore.
Exceptional academics, opportunities, and facilities. The price is so expensive, so I docked off one star for that purpose.

Being in Riverside, there's mountains, beaches, hills, mountains, and a desert all together (with 30 minutes distance). you can bike, swim, climb, or simply hang out at local cafes. It's to your advantage that Riverside has everything any college student can ask for. It's both metropolitan (in the city) yet suburban (homely) at the same time. This school offers the best of everything.
Phenomenal food ranging from Asian food, Mediterranean, Italian, pizza, and sushi. There's something new daily, everything is beyond delicious.
CBU has two options for freshman housing: cottages and dorms. The cottages is very unique in that there's a courtyard and porches, while offering everything a dorm has. They're both very traditional.

The academic rigor is set perfectly. It's not so demanding that students get stressed or confused, but enough to challenge students to think rigorously and make an honest effort to achieve good grades. The challenging academic environment, along with the professors who are professionals in their field makes the education so much more worthwhile.

Take advantage of all the resources CBU has to offer. CBU is known for having a plethora of faith-based opportunities, so engaging in ministry or learning from your peers will always be an option if you're interested in learning more about Christ. Finally, the school is especially known for its renowned International Service Projects, where you preach about Jesus in other countries-- it's an eye-opening experience allowing all participants to grow closer to God.

California Baptist University offers everything any students could ask for: a world-class teaching facility, recreational and intramural sports, an academic resource center, a career services center, on top of an intimate, close-nit community ready for a hands on learning environment. As the only Baptist university in the state of California, it offers a faith-based education, fully integrated in all classroom settings. California Baptist University is an up and coming school offering astounding food, great safety, and an abundance of resources so that all students can achieve future goals.

textAfterTable: Tips for prospective students Be prepared to study, write papers, and read more than you ever have before. Throughout my previous years in school I maintained a high grade point average, but I still have to work very hard to maintain such a high GPA in college. Do your best to get involved in at least one sport, club, or bible study group. The friendships, memories, and values you'll gain are life-changing and it will make you feel home away from home. Bang for the buck I will admit that CBU is very expensive, but so is every other private university. The christian environment, caring professors, and lifelong friendships you'll make guarantee that the high cost of enrolling at CBU is truly worth every penny! Am enjoying being here I am still amazed everyday at how much of a blessing it is to be attending CBU and to be able to live on campus. The faculty is so friendly and helpful. Even my professors truly care about my grade and they strive for me to succeed. The professors really care about you as a person and they are available to help with school or even things that aren't school-related. I love my school and I can't imagine being anywhere else! Am
